sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
feed.summary: Analysts have issued a "Moderate Buy" consensus recommendation for CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) based on ratings from six brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $6.33. Despite recent insider sales totaling $1.7 million, insiders still control 52% of outstanding shares. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.08, reflecting a 7.8% yield.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Can Arbitrate Consumers’ Video Privacy Claims
feed.summary: A federal court has ruled that claims against CuriosityStream Inc. for allegedly sharing video-viewing histories with Meta Platforms Inc. will be handled by an arbitrator, not in federal court. Judge Stephanie A. Gallagher granted CuriosityStream's motion to compel arbitration, rejecting arguments that the company waived its right to arbitration by failing to pay fees in a previous mass-arbitration bid. This decision moves the proposed class action lawsuit out of the federal court system.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Can Arbitrate Consumers’ Video Privacy Claims
feed.summary: A federal judge has ruled that claims against CuriosityStream Inc. for allegedly sharing video-viewing histories with Meta Platforms Inc. must be resolved through arbitration. The streaming service's motion to compel arbitration was granted, rejecting the plaintiffs' argument that CuriosityStream waived its right to arbitrate. This decision will direct these video privacy claims to an arbitrator rather than a federal court.

feed.title: CuriosityStream to Participate at 14th Annual ROTH Deer Valley Event
feed.summary: CuriosityStream, Inc. announced its participation in the 14th Annual ROTH Deer Valley Event, where management will hold one-on-one meetings from December 10th to 13th, 2025. The event will take place at the Montage Deer Valley in Park City, Utah. The company, a global factual entertainment media provider, will be represented at this significant financial event to engage with investors.

feed.title: CuriosityStream appoints John Higgins as VP of content partnerships By Investing.com
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. has appointed John Higgins as Vice President of Content Partnerships, tasked with expanding licensing relationships with technology and AI developer partners. Higgins will focus on deepening ties with hyperscalers and AI developers, leveraging CuriosityStream's extensive content library as a high-growth engine for AI content licensing. This strategic move aligns with the company's strong year-to-date stock performance and recent licensing agreements with major platforms like Netflix and DIRECTV.

feed.title: CuriosityStream (NASDAQ: CURI) adds AI deals using 1.8M hours; Netflix among partners
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. (Nasdaq: CURI) has announced new licensing agreements for its factual entertainment content with major global partners like Netflix, Canela Media, AMC Southern Europe, and Foxtel Australia. The company has also expanded its leadership in AI dataset licensing, partnering with eight leading AI developers and offering over 1.8 million hours of ethically sourced video and audio content for AI training. CuriosityStream anticipates licensing revenue to surpass half of its subscription revenue in 2025 due to strong demand for its content across traditional and AI platforms.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
feed.summary: Analysts have given CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating, with an average 1-year price target of $6.33. This comes despite the company missing Q3 EPS estimates but beating revenue expectations, while still showing negative net margin and return on equity. Insiders have sold a significant number of shares recently, though they still collectively own about 52% of the company's stock.

feed.title: Los Angeles Capital Management LLC Purchases Shares of 89,592 CuriosityStream Inc. $CURI
feed.summary: Los Angeles Capital Management LLC recently acquired 89,592 shares of CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) valued at approximately $504,000, boosting institutional ownership to 6.79%. This investment comes as CuriosityStream announced a quarterly dividend and despite missing EPS expectations, insider selling, and a current average analyst rating of "Moderate Buy." Several other institutional investors also modified their holdings in CuriosityStream during the second quarter.

feed.title: Acadian Asset Management LLC Raises Position in CuriosityStream Inc. $CURI
feed.summary: Acadian Asset Management LLC significantly increased its stake in CuriosityStream Inc. ($CURI) by 124.5% in Q2, acquiring an additional 246,804 shares, bringing its total to 445,082 shares valued at approximately $2.5 million. This comes as CuriousityStream reported a Q3 revenue beat but an EPS miss, maintaining an average analyst rating of "Moderate Buy" with a $6.33 price target. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.08, despite recent insider share sales.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Inc. Stock (CURI) Opinions on Q3 2025 Earnings Report
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. (CURI) reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, with a 46% year-over-year revenue increase and positive operating cash flow, leading to significant positive buzz on X. The company's strategic move into AI video training data licensing is seen as a promising high-margin opportunity, despite concerns about subscription revenue and an earnings miss. Insider activity shows a high volume of sales over the past six months, while institutional investors have largely increased their holdings.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Reports 46% Year-over-Year Revenue Increase
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. announced strong financial results for Q3 2025, with revenue increasing 46% year-over-year to $18.4 million and operating cash flow up 101% to $4.5 million. The company reported a significant improvement in Adjusted EBITDA to positive $3.0 million and declared a cash dividend of $0.08 per share. This growth is attributed to disciplined execution, recurring demand for content, and momentum in retail and wholesale subscriptions, as well as AI and traditional licensing.

feed.title: CuriosityStream appoints John Higgins as VP of content partnerships
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. has appointed John Higgins as Vice President of Content Partnerships to enhance licensing relationships with technology and AI developer partners. Higgins, who previously launched the Curiosity Audio Network and oversaw Curiosity University, will focus on engaging hyperscalers and AI developers for video content. This move underscores CuriosityStream's strategy to leverage its extensive content library for AI licensing, complementing its global subscription services.

feed.title: Certain Common Stock of CuriosityStream Inc. are subject to a Lock-Up Agreement Ending on 10-NOV-2025.
feed.summary: Shares of CuriosityStream Inc. common stock are currently subject to a lock-up agreement that will end on November 10, 2025. This agreement affects directors, officers, and certain stockholders, restricting them from selling or transferring their common stock for a period of 90 to 180 days from August 12, 2025. The purpose of such a lock-up is to prevent significant selling pressure immediately after a public offering.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Names John Higgins Vice President, Content Partnerships, to Accelerate Growth in AI Licensing and Strategic Alliances
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. has appointed John Higgins as Vice President, Content Partnerships, to drive growth in AI licensing and strategic alliances. Higgins will focus on expanding relationships with technology and AI Developer partners, leveraging CuriosityStream's extensive premium video library. This move aims to solidify CuriosityStream's position at the intersection of knowledge, media, and artificial intelligence, complementing its core subscription services with a high-growth AI content licensing division.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Names John Higgins Vice President, Content Partnerships
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. has appointed John Higgins as Vice President, Content Partnerships, where he will focus on expanding the company's licensing relationships with technology and AI developer partners. Higgins will report directly to President and CEO Clint Stinchcomb, who praised his work in advancing AI licensing initiatives and leveraging CuriosityStream's extensive video library. This role highlights CuriosityStream's commitment to growing its AI content licensing division alongside its core subscription services.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Names New VP of Content Partnerships
feed.summary: John Higgins has been appointed VP of content partnerships at CuriosityStream, tasked with accelerating growth in AI licensing and strategic alliances. Higgins will focus on building licensing relationships with major technology and AI developer partners, reporting directly to president and CEO Clint Stinchcomb. His previous work at CuriosityStream includes launching the Curiosity Audio Network and advancing AI licensing initiatives through ethically sourced video content.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Unveils New Licensing Partnerships Across Global Media and Next-Generation AI Platforms
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. (Nasdaq: CURI) announced new licensing agreements for its content across traditional television, global streaming services, and AI training platforms. These partnerships highlight the strong global demand for CuriosityStream's premium video and audio content. The company also enhanced its technical infrastructure to support the accelerating demand for structured video datasets used in AI development.

feed.title: 110,872 Shares in CuriosityStream Inc. $CURI Acquired by Evernest Financial Advisors LLC
feed.summary: Evernest Financial Advisors LLC has acquired 110,872 shares of CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) valued at approximately $624,000, representing 0.19% of the company. This comes amidst recent insider selling by the CFO and a Director, who decreased their holdings significantly. Despite insider sales, Wall Street analysts maintain optimistic ratings for CuriosityStream, with a consensus target price of $6.33 for its stock.

feed.title: Penbrook Management LLC Sells 84,250 Shares of CuriosityStream Inc. $CURI
feed.summary: Penbrook Management LLC significantly reduced its stake in CuriosityStream Inc. (NASDAQ:CURI) by selling 84,250 shares, now holding 76,100 shares valued at $428,000. Meanwhile, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. substantially increased its ownership in CuriosityStream, which holds an average price target of $6.33 from analysts. The report also details other institutional investor activity, analyst ratings, stock performance, and dividend announcements for CuriosityStream.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Inc. (CURI) Becomes Penn Mutual’s 18th Largest Holding
feed.summary: Penn Mutual Asset Management has significantly increased its stake in CuriosityStream Inc. (CURI) by purchasing 245,289 additional shares, making it their 18th largest holding. The streaming company, which has seen its stock climb over 250% this year, is benefiting from AI licensing revenues through deals to use its content for model training. Analysts note that continued AI content licenses and cost-cutting initiatives will be crucial for CURI's future growth.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Wins Dismissal of TikTok Trap and Trace Suit
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. successfully had a proposed class action dismissed, which alleged the company installed a TikTok tracking tool on its website in violation of California's Invasion of Privacy Act. The court ruled that the plaintiff lacked Article III standing, as metadata collection doesn't carry an expectation of privacy, and if communication data was collected, the tool didn't qualify as a "trap and trace" device under the CIPA.

feed.title: Curiosity Stream Goes Global: Major Prime Video Partnership Brings Factual Content to 8 Countries
feed.summary: Curiosity Inc. announced the launch of its streaming service, Curiosity Stream, as an add-on subscription on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand. This expansion builds on existing partnerships in the U.S., U.K., India, Netherlands, Sweden, and Finland, allowing Prime Video members in Australia and New Zealand to access Curiosity Stream's extensive library of factual content. The move reinforces Curiosity's strategy of global, platform-integrated distribution to reach new audiences.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: CuriosityStream’s Q2 2025 earnings beat forecasts, stock dips
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. (CURI) reported strong Q2 2025 financial results, with significant revenue and EPS beats, and achieved a record adjusted EBITDA of $3 million. Despite these positive outcomes, the stock initially dipped by 4.67% during regular trading hours, though it saw a slight increase in after-hours trading. The company is strategically focusing on expanding its AI video licensing market, leveraging its extensive content library and intellectual property for future growth.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Inc. (CURI) Meets Q2 Earnings Estimates
feed.summary: CuriosityStream Inc. (CURI) reported Q2 earnings of $0.01 per share, matching the Zacks Consensus Estimate and showing significant improvement from a loss of $0.04 per share a year ago. The company also surpassed revenue expectations with $19.01 million, beating the consensus by 12.50%. Despite strong stock performance this year, the current Zacks Rank for CURI is #3 (Hold), suggesting it will perform in line with the market.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Announces Dividend Amid Strong Revenue Growth
feed.summary: CuriosityStream announced a quarterly cash dividend of $0.08 per share, payable on September 19, 2025. The company reported a significant 53% year-over-year revenue increase to $19 million for Q2 2025, driven by successful AI partnerships and new service launches. This financial growth is further supported by record net income and EBITDA, alongside expanded distribution agreements, leading to a moderately positive outlook from TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark.

feed.title: Save $250 on lifetime access to thousands of world-class docs
feed.summary: This article promotes a lifetime subscription to Curiosity Stream, a documentary streaming service founded by the creator of the Discovery Channel. Currently on sale for $149.97 (a $250 discount), it offers access to thousands of award-winning documentaries across various subjects. The deal is highlighted as a one-time payment for endless educational content, without recurring monthly fees.

feed.title: Get Curiosity Stream, a documentary streaming service, for life for $150
feed.summary: Curiosity Stream, a documentary streaming service, is available for a lifetime subscription at $149.97, down from its regular price of $399.99. This platform offers a vast collection of nonfiction content spanning science, nature, history, tech, and space, with new titles added regularly and narrated by figures like David Attenborough. This deal provides an extensive library for documentary enthusiasts seeking content that educates and entertains, without monthly fees.

feed.title: Endless Docs Await! Save 60% on a Curiosity Stream Lifetime Subscription - Watch Thousands of Cool Docs
feed.summary: This article highlights a deal for a lifetime subscription to Curiosity Stream, a documentary streaming service, offering a 60% discount. It describes Curiosity Stream as "old school Discovery Channel" focusing on science, technology, history, nature, and art, featuring acclaimed experts and award-winning content. The article emphasizes the cost savings compared to monthly streaming services over the long term.

feed.title: CuriosityStream class action
feed.summary: A federal court in Maryland denied CuriosityStream's motion for reconsideration in a class action lawsuit. Subscribers claim the video subscription service unlawfully disclosed their personally identifiable information to Facebook. The court found that CuriosityStream failed to prove that online users assented to their terms of service.

feed.title: Federal Judge Rejects CuriosityStream's Reliance on 'Sign Up Now' Button As Expressing Agreement to 'Terms of Use'
feed.summary: A federal judge in Maryland denied CuriosityStream's motions for arbitration and to dismiss a class-action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges violations of the Video Privacy Protection Act and California state law due to the streaming service allegedly disclosing users' personally identifiable information to Facebook. The judge ruled that the "Sign up now" button did not constitute clear notice or express agreement to the company's Terms of Use.

feed.title: CuriosityStream Preps Original New Series: 'Rescued Chimpanzees of the Congo with Jane Goodall'
feed.summary: CuriosityStream announced the production of a new five-part original series, 'Rescued Chimpanzees of the Congo with Jane Goodall,' set to premiere in spring 2021. The series will feature never-before-seen footage and archival material spanning three decades of the Jane Goodall Institute's efforts to rescue and rehabilitate chimpanzees that are victims of illegal wildlife trafficking at its Tchimpounga Chimpanzee Rehabilitation Center. It will highlight intimate stories of these chimpanzees and the dedicated staff, including Dr. Jane Goodall and Dr. Rebeca Atencia.

feed.title: CuriosityStream and Tata Sky Announce New Distribution Partnership to Bring World-Class Factual Entertainment to Viewers Across India
feed.summary: CuriosityStream, a leading factual streaming service, has partnered with Tata Sky, India's largest content distribution platform, to offer thousands of hours of documentary films and series to viewers across India. This partnership will make CuriosityStream's award-winning content available through Tata Sky Binge and as a linear service on television, significantly expanding CuriosityStream's reach in the dynamic Indian media market. Subscribers will gain access to exclusive originals and popular titles spanning science, history, space, technology, and more.
